line-7: Key Vacancy Information:  Job Title: Senior Construction Manager  Role Type: Full Time, Permanent  Location: York George Stephenson House   Closing date: 20th November 2023  Salary: salary starting at �55,596 and increasing to �62,546 (plus Employee Healthcare)  Annual Leave: 28 days + bank holidays  Hours: 35 per week     *Employees will be entitled to a 75% discount off leisure travel from December 2022, this includes all Advance, off peak and super off peak tickets*     About Network Rail:   Network Rail has played a key role in keeping the country moving during the coronavirus pandemic � and we will play an equally important part in rebuilding from it.  We get people where they need to be, whether they are commuting to work, visiting friends or family, or going for a night out.  We make millions of lives better every day and have a vital job in driving the economy and prosperity of the nation!  https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=nLZ7OYSoQVU  Over the coming years we will be building and improving crucial rail links between the country�s biggest cities, making our services faster, more comfortable and more reliable for the people who rely on us. In joining Network Rail, you�re not only joining an organisation with a vital role to play for the country, but also a team of more than 40,000 people, and a business dedicated to being one of Britain�s best employers.  The Asset Protection team supports external parties completing work alongside Network Rail infrastructure, facilitating smooth, efficient, and successful project delivery whilst ensuring there is no impact on the safe and reliable operation of the railway now or in the future. There are an increasing number of third-party organisations who wish to invest directly in railway infrastructure, improving existing stations, constructing new stations, depot upgrades and freight terminals, and even re-opening old lines. Our outside party portfolio includes new bridges, complex utility schemes, (including NRSWA schemes), developers, and facilitating maintenance and examinations. Network Rails open for business philosophy means we offer opportunity for partners to develop and deliver schemes themselves, working alongside our asset protection team who provide project management. engineering and construction assurance.
line-9: This construction leadership position requires a background in either construction management or engineering management on multi-discipline projects within the railway environment, reflecting our growing portfolio of more complex outside party and third-party schemes.  This Senior Construction Manager role is a new role within Asset Protection and will report to the Programme Engineering Manager. It will provide the successful candidate the opportunity to set new processes, procedures, and define and control the construction management assurance framework (alignment to NR/L2/RSE/CONM/001) for all Asset Protection activities in the region.The successful candidate will have a strong focus on developing construction management competence to include training and mentoring plans for the wider construction management team which consists of Construction Managers, Assistant Construction Managers and Construction Management Assistants. Growing a skilled and flexible team able to meet the long-term resource requirements and deliver an effective service.The role will also lead in the construction management assurance of a significant portfolio of third party and outside party schemes, with focus on safety, quality, environment, engineering/design compliance, and commissioning/entry into service.The role requires an office and site presence and will involve covering on-call alongside the Asset Protection Leadership team on a 4-6 week rota basis. The role will be based in York and will geographically cover the Eastern Region. The role may include overnight stays and some weekend and night work.  The right candidate will have previous experience in complex engineering and construction schemes, leading teams, and have knowledge/application of legislation, regulations, and Network Rail standards applicable to the role. They will also have enough confidence and experience to apply sound construction and engineering judgement, and customer centric to supply a construction management assurance service to our customers. Learn more about our Asset Protection and Optimisation team here: https://www.networkrail.co.uk/running-the-railway/looking-after-the-railway/asset-protection-and-optimisation
